contextId.occurrenceNote: It may be helpful to explicitly state that this was the large battle that followed the contest of the young men. Alternate translation: "Then the others started to fight also. It was a very fierce battle that day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The battle was very severe that day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the handle, which is not sharp or designed to pierce anything. It can be implied that Abner was only trying to stop Asahel from following him, and did not intend to kill him. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the blunt end of his spear

contextId.occurrenceNote: Trumpets were used to signal orders to the armies across great distances. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: blew the trumpet

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paltiel was Michal's second husband. Saul gave her to him after David fled from Saul. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: took her from her husband

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they are taking the ark to Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "from Baalah in Judah to take to Jerusalem the ark of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: from Baalah in Judah to bring up from there the ark of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make explicit that the cherubim are those on the lid of the ark of the covenant. The biblical writers often spoke of the ark of the covenant as if it were Yahweh's footstool upon which he rested his feet as he sat on his throne in heaven above. Alternate translation: "who sits on his throne above the cherubim on the ark of the covenant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: who sits enthroned over the cherubim

contextId.occurrenceNote: It was a sin for Uzzah to touch the ark because Yahweh had commanded that no one should touch the ark. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for his sin

contextId.occurrenceNote: Cedar is a kind of tree that is known for its strength. If you have an equivalent type of tree in your culture, you can use that name, otherwise you can reword this. Alternate translation: "I am living in a strong, permanent house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I am living in a house of cedar

contextId.occurrenceNote: Tents are temporary dwellings. If you do not have tents in your culture, you can word this differently. Alternate translation: "the ark of God is staying in a temporary place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the ark of God is staying in the middle of a tent

contextId.occurrenceNote: A recorder was a person who spoke to the people and told them the king's announcements. Alternate translation: "Ahilud was the herald" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Ahilud was recorder

contextId.occurrenceNote: This act was meant as an insult to humiliate the men. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: shaved off half their beards

contextId.occurrenceNote: David sent them out to war. This can be stated clearly. Also, the word "his" refers to David. Alternate translation: "David sent Joab, his servants, and all the army of Israel to war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: David sent out Joab, his servants, and all the army of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The woman was not on the roof, she would have been bathing outside in the courtyard of her house. Alternate translation: "a woman who was bathing in the courtyard of her house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: a woman who was bathing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to men of the city shooting arrows down at their enemy from the top of the city wall. Alternate translation: "shoot arrows at you from the top of the city wall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: shoot from the wall

contextId.occurrenceNote: It was for his visitor to eat. Alternate translation: "for his visitor to eat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for his visitor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This expresses that David was swearing an oath or serious promise. Alternate translation: "I declare, as surely as Yahweh lives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: As Yahweh lives

contextId.occurrenceNote: David went into his room when he was alone. Alternate translation: "went inside his room" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: went inside

contextId.occurrenceNote: "day 7." This refers to the seventh day after the baby was born. Alternate translation: "the seventh day after he was born" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-numbers]])
contextId.glQuote: the seventh day

contextId.occurrenceNote: David implies that he will go to where his child is when he dies. Alternate translation: "When I die I will go to where he is" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I will go to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Amnon was frustrated because he desired to sleep with his sister Tamar. Alternate translation: "Amnon was so frustrated with desire for his sister Tamar that he felt sick" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Amnon was so frustrated that he became sick because of his sister Tamar

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means to lock the door so that she will not be able to come back in again. Alternate translation: "lock the door so that she cannot come back in" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: bolt the door after her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means to lock the door so that she will not be able to come back in again. Alternate translation: "locked the door so that she could not go back in" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: bolted the door after her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This implies that they do not need to be afraid of the consequences for killing Amnon. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Do not be afraid that you will be blamed for killing the king's son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not be afraid

contextId.occurrenceNote: If they put the guilty brother to death there would not be a son left to inherit the family's possessions. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Alternate translation: "if they did this, they would be destroying our family's heir" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they would also destroy the heir

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that if people say that the king was wrong for helping the woman's family that the king should not be guilty. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "if anyone blames you for helping our family, may my family be considered guilty instead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: may the guilt be on me and on my father's family

contextId.occurrenceNote: "are innocent." This implies that in the future if anyone accuses the king of wrongdoing, he will be innocent in the matter. Alternate translation: "will be innocent regarding the matter" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: are guiltless

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the man who wants to avenge the death of the dead brother. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "the man who wants to avenge my son's brother's death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the avenger of blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: The woman is implying that David should bring his son back to himself. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "God brings back someone whom he has driven away and you should do the same for your son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: God ... finds a way for those who were driven away to be restored

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that the king had Joab brought before him so that he could speak to him. The full meaning of this can be made clear. Alternate translation: "Then the king summoned Joab and said to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: So the king said to Joab

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to what Joab wants the king to do. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Alternate translation: "what you want me to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: this thing

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that Absalom wanted Joab to come to him to see him and to intercede for him so that he would be allowed to see the king. The full meaning of this can be made clear. Alternate translation: "to come to him and to intercede for him so that he could see the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to send him to the king

contextId.occurrenceNote: The message here for the king is written as if Absalom were the speaker. Absalom was asking Joab to speak the message on his behalf. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Alternate translation: "to say to the king on my behalf" or "to ask the king for me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to the king to say

contextId.occurrenceNote: This implies that the king forgave and restored Absalom. The full meaning of this can be made clear. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: the king kissed Absalom

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that the person told his case to Absalom. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Absalom would ask him what his problem was, and the man would then explain to Absalom why he sought justice. Absalom would then say to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: So Absalom would say to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that they can for the king to decide their disputes. Alternate translation: "to judge over their disputes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for judgment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to four years after he returned to Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "fours years after Absalom had returned to Jerusalem, he" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: at the end of four years that Absalom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the last house they would come to when leaving the city. Alternate translation: "at the last house as they were leaving the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: at the last house

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a blessing that David is giving to him. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh be faithful and loyal to you always" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: May loyalty and faithfulness go with you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the king implies he is to receive a message informing him about what is happening in Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "to tell me what is happening in Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to inform me

contextId.occurrenceNote: David is asking Yahweh to make Ahitohphel's advice foolish and useless. Alternate translation: "please let whatever advice Ahithophel gives be foolishness and unsuccessful" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: please turn Ahithophel's advice into foolishness

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "top" is used here because David went up in elevation and is at the top of a hill. Alternate translation: "at the top of the hill" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: at the top of the road

contextId.occurrenceNote: David is suggest to Hushai that he oppose whatever Ahithopel advises. Alternate translation: "you can serve me by by opposing Ahithophel's advice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you will confuse Ahithophel's advice for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh repays them by punishing them. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has punished" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh has repaid

contextId.occurrenceNote: David reigned as king over the same people whom Saul had previously reigned. Alternate translation: "in whose place you have reigned as king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: in whose place you have reigned

contextId.occurrenceNote: David describes his son this way to emphasize the close bond between a father and his son. Alternate translation: "my own son" or "my dear son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: my son, who was born from my body

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that he intends to kill the king. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "I will kill only the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I will attack only the king

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to all of the people who were with David. Alternate translation: "bring back all of the people who were with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: bring back all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that his has fought in many battles and knows well the ways of war. Alternate translation: "has fought in many battles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: is a man of war

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the soldiers would tear down the city walls and drag the pieces to river. Alternate translation: "will destroy the city and drag the stones to the river with ropes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: will bring ropes to that city and we will drag it into the river

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they found out that the young man had told Absalom about them being there. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Jonathan and Ahimaaz found out what the young man had done, so they went away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: So Jonathan and Ahimaaz went away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he will go out with them to battle. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "I myself will go with you to battle" or "I personally will go with you into battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I will certainly go out with you myself, too

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the enemy army considering killing David of greater worth than killing 10,000 of the other men. The number 10,000 here is an exaggeration used to emphasize a very great number of people. Alternate translation: "they would rather kill you than to kill 10,000 of us" or "killing you is worth more to them than killing a great number of us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: you are worth ten thousand of us

contextId.occurrenceNote: David could help them from the city by advising them and sending men to help them. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "that you stay here in the city and send help to us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: that you be ready to help us from the city

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that they went out and fought against them in battle. Alternate translation: "went out into the countryside and fought against Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: went out into the countryside against Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an event that happened during the battle. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "During the battle, Absalom happened to meet some of David's soldiers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Absalom happened to meet some of David's soldiers

contextId.occurrenceNote: Joab meant that he should not continue talking to the man. Alternate translation: "I will not waste anymore time talking to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I will not wait for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This describes what Joab commanded by blowing the trumpet. Alternate translation: "Then Joab blew the trumpet to call back the army, and the army returned from pursuing Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Then Joab blew the trumpet, and the army returned from pursuing Israel, for Joab held back the army

contextId.occurrenceNote: After putting his body in the pit they covered it with a pile of stones. This can be stated more clearly. Alternate translation: "they covered his body with a huge pile of stones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they buried his body under a very large pile of stones

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to not bearing the news to the king. Alternate translation: "you will not tell the news to the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you will bear no news

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the whole army mourned instead of celebrating. AT "So instead of celebrating victory that day, the whole army mourned" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: So the victory that day was turned into mourning for all the army

contextId.occurrenceNote: Joab is making a very strong oath. Alternate translation: "I swear, as surely as Yahweh is alive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I swear by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he had left the country fleeing from Absalom. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "out of the country fleeing from Absalom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: out of the land because of Absalom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the king was there and was aware of what was happening. Alternate translation: "at the place where the king was" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: in the presence of the king

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to David. It means that he is the man that Yahweh had anointed as king. Alternate translation: "the man that Yahweh has anointed as king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh's anointed

contextId.occurrenceNote: David is asking Mephibosheth why he did not go with David when David and all the people who followed him left Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "Why did you not go with me when I left Jerusalem, Mephibosheth?" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Why did you not go with me, Mephibosheth?

contextId.occurrenceNote: This does not mean that he wants to die right next to their graves, but rather, that he wants to die in the city where they are buried. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "where my father's and my mother's graves are" or "where my father and my mother are buried" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: by the grave of my father and my mother

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to crossing the Jordan River. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Kimham will cross the river with me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Kimham will go over with me

contextId.occurrenceNote: "we have a greater claim to David than you do." It may be helpful to state clearly what having "more right" means. Alternate translation: "we have more right to serve the king and to be with the king than you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: we have even more right to David than you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that Sheba and his men will enter these cities to hide from David's army. The word "he" represents Sheba but refers to both him and his men. Alternate translation: "he and his men will hide in fortified cities" or "he and his men will take refuge in fortified cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: he will find fortified cities

contextId.occurrenceNote: Joab let the sword fall out to fool Amasa into thinking that he Joab was unarmed, so that Amasa would allow him to walk closer to him. Alternate translation: "he allowed the sword to fall on the ground so Amasa would think he was unarmed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the sword fell out

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Amasa lay squirming in his blood." Amasa may have still been alive and rolling in his blood, but he was probably dead by this time. It is described this way to show how gruesome his body looked. Alternate translation: "Amasa lay dead in his blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means they stopped walking and were staring at Amasa's dead body. Alternate translation: "all the people stood still staring at the dead body ... came by him stood still, staring at his dead body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people stood still ... came by him stood still

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that they used a battering ram to knock down the wall. A battering ram was a cut tree or large log with a sharpened end or an end covered in metal. It was held by several men who would pound the end against a wall. Alternate translation: "used a battering ram to knock down the wall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: battered the wall to knock it down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the woman acted wisely and spoke to her people about what they should do. Alternate translation: "Then the wise woman spoke to all the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the army returned after Eleazar returned from battle. Alternate translation: "The Israeli army returned to the battle field after Eleazer had already won the battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The army returned after Eleazar

contextId.occurrenceNote: In the law of Moses, God prohibited the kings of Israel from taking a census of fighting men. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Go, count Israel and Judah
